hpnicfMplsVpn.name: hpnicfMplsVpn

revisions.description: Re-published as PPVPN working group draft. No changes between this version and last; just name change.

Removed hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetImport/Export from route target table, and modified indexing to better reflect N <> R distribution policy. Also added new object called hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetType which denotes import/export policy for the specified route target. Added hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfRowStatus which allows for an interface to be associated with a VPN through SNMP configuration. Added VrfName to index of VrfInterfaceConfEntry which allows interfaces to be associated with the appropriate VRF. Modified description of hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfMaxPossibleRoutes and hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfMaxRoutes to allow for undetermined value. Removed 'both' enumerated value in hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrRole. Updated example to reflect these changes.

Renamed hpnicfmplsNumVrfSecViolationThreshExceeded to hpnicfmplsNumVrfSecIllegalLabelThreshExceeded, and removed hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfIndex from varbind. Changed HpnicfMplsVpnId TC from SnmpAdminString to OCTET STRING. Added hpnicfmplsVpnVrfSecIllegalLabelRcvThresh to hpnicfmplsVpnVrfSecEntry. Changed duplicate hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetImport in hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetEntry INDEX to hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetExport.
Updated most of document and MIB to reflect comments from WG.

hpnicfMplsVpn.description: This MIB contains managed object definitions for the Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS)/Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) as defined in : Rosen, E., Viswanathan, A., and R. Callon, Multiprotocol Label Switching Architecture, Internet Draft <draft-ietf-mpls-arch-06.txt>, August 1999.

HpnicfMplsVpnId.name: HpnicfMplsVpnId
HpnicfMplsVpnId.description: An identifier that is assigned to each MPLS/BGP VPN and is used to uniquely identify it. This is assigned by the system operator or NMS and SHOULD be unique throughout the MPLS domain. If this is the case, then this identifier can then be used at any LSR within a specific MPLS domain to identify this MPLS/BGP VPN. It may also be possible to preserve the uniqueness of this identifier across MPLS domain boundaries, in which case this identifier can then be used to uniquely identify MPLS/BGP VPNs on a more global basis.
HpnicfMplsVpnId.reference: RFC 2685 [VPN-RFC2685] Fox B., et al, 'Virtual Private Networks Identifier', September 1999.

HpnicfMplsVpnRouteDistinguisher.name: HpnicfMplsVpnRouteDistinguisher
HpnicfMplsVpnRouteDistinguisher.description: Syntax for a route distinguisher and route target.

hpnicfmplsVpnConfiguredVrfs.name: hpnicfmplsVpnConfiguredVrfs
hpnicfmplsVpnConfiguredVrfs.description: The number of VRFs which are configured on this node.

hpnicfmplsVpnActiveVrfs.name: hpnicfmplsVpnActiveVrfs
hpnicfmplsVpnActiveVrfs.description: The number of VRFs which are active on this node. That is, those whose operStatus = Up (1).

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfTable.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfTable
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfTable.description: This table specifies per-interface MPLS capability and associated information.

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfEntry.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfEntry
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LSR for every interface capable of supporting MPLS/BGP VPN. Each entry in this table is meant to correspond to an entry in the Interfaces Table.

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfIndex.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfIndex
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfIndex.reference: RFC 2233 - The Interfaces Group MIB using SMIv2, McCloghrie, K., and F. Kastenholtz, Nov. 1997
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfIndex.description: This is a unique index for an entry in the hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfTable.

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceLabelEdgeType.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceLabelEdgeType
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceLabelEdgeType.description: Either the providerEdge(1) (PE) or customerEdge(2) (CE) bit MUST be set.

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceVpnClassification.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceVpnClassification
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceVpnClassification.description: Denotes whether this link participates in a carrier-of-carrier's, enterprise, or inter-provider scenario.

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceIpAddress.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceIpAddress
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceIpAddress.description: The IP address of this interface.

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceIpAddressMask.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceIpAddressMask
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceIpAddressMask.description: The IP address mask of this interface.

hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfRowStatus.name: hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfRowStatus
hpnicfmplsVpnInterfaceConfRowStatus.description: The row status for this entry. This value is used to create a row in this table, signifying that the specified interface is to be associated with the specified interface. If this operation suceeds, the interface will have been associated, otherwise the agent would not allow the association. If the agent only allows read-only operations on this table, it will create entries in this table as they are created.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfTable.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfTable
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfTable.description: This table specifies per-interface MPLS/BGP VPN VRF Table capability and associated information. Entries in this table define VRF routing instances associated with MPLS/VPN interfaces. Note that multiple interfaces can belong to the same VRF instance. The collection of all VRF instances comprises an actual VPN.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfEntry.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfEntry
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LSR for every VRF capable of supporting MPLS/BGP VPN. The indexing provides an ordering of VRFs per-VPN interface.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfName.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfName
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfName.reference: RFC 2685 [VPN-RFC2685] Fox B., et al, `Virtual Private Networks Identifier`, September 1999.
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfName.description: The human-readable name of this VPN. This MAY be equivalent to the RFC2685 VPN-ID.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDistinguisher.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDistinguisher
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDistinguisher.description: The route distinguisher for this VRF.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfNetPrefixType.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfNetPrefixType
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfNetPrefixType.description: Denotes the type network prefix in use for the PE-CE connections.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfNetPrefix.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfNetPrefix
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfNetPrefix.description: Denotes the network prefix for the PE-CE connections.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeConn.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeConn
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeConn.description: Denotes the redistribution of directly connected networks into the VRF BGP table.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeStati.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeStatic
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeStati.description: Denotes the redistribution of static routes into the VRF BGP table.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeRip.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeRip
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfIpRouteRedistributeRip.description: Denotes the redistribution of rip routes into the VRF BGP table.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfHighRouteThreshold.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfHighRouteThreshold
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfHighRouteThreshold.description: Denotes high-level water marker for the number of routes which this VRF may hold.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfIsWarnOnly.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfIsWarnOnly
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfIsWarnOnly.description: Denotes the action when the amount of VPN's routes exceed the hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfHighRouteThreshold.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfMaxRoutes.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfMaxRoutes
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfMaxRoutes.description: Denotes maximum number of routes which this VRF is configured to hold. This value MUST be less than or equal to hpnicfmplsVrfMaxPossibleRoutes unless it is set to 0.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfRowStatus.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfRowStatus
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfConfRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetTable.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetTable
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetTable.description: This table specifies per-VRF route target association. Each entry identifies a connectivity policy supported as part of a VPN.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetEntry.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetEntry
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LSR for each route target configured for a VRF supporting a MPLS/BGP VPN instance. The indexing provides an ordering per-VRF instance.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetType.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetType
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTargetType.description: The route target export distribution type.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAddrTable.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAddrTable
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAddrTable.description: This table specifies per-interface MPLS/BGP neighbor addresses for both PEs and CEs.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAddrEntry.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAddrEntry
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAddrEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LSR for every VRF capable of supporting MPLS/BGP VPN. The indexing provides an ordering of VRFs per-VPN interface.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrRole.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrRole
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrRole.description: Denotes the role played by this BGP neighbor with respect to this VRF.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrType.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrType
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrType.description: Denotes the address family of the PE address.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAsNumber.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAsNumber
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAsNumber.description: The Automonous System that the BGP's neighbour in.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAdminStatus.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAdminStatus
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrAdminStatus.description: The action set by SNMP client.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrRowStatus.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrRowStatus
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfBgpNbrRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTable.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTable
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTable.reference: 1. RFC 1213 Section 6.6, The IP Group. 2. RFC 2096
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteTable.description: This table specifies per-interface MPLS/BGP VPN VRF Table routing information. Entries in this table define VRF routing entries associated with the specified MPLS/VPN interfaces. Note that this table contains both BGP and IGP routes, as both may appear in the same VRF.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteEntry.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteEntry
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LSR for every route present configured (either dynamically or statically) within the context of a specific VRF capable of supporting MPLS/BGP VPN. The indexing provides an ordering of VRFs per-VPN interface.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDest.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDest
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDest.description: The destination IP address of this route. This object may not take a Multicast (Class D) address value.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteMask.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteMask
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteMask.description: Indicate the mask to be logical-ANDed with the destination address before being compared to the value in the hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDest field. For those systems that do not support arbitrary subnet masks, an agent constructs the value of the hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteMask by reference to the IP Address Class. Any assignment (implicit or otherwise) of an instance of this object to a value x must be rejected if the bit-wise logical-AND of x with the value of the corresponding instance of the hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDest object is not equal to hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteDest.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteNextHop.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteNextHop
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteNextHop.description: On remote routes, the address of the next system en route; Otherwise, 0.0.0.0. .

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteIfIndex.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteIfIndex
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value that identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteProto.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteProto
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteProto.description: The routing mechanism via which this route was learned. Inclusion of values for gateway rout- ing protocols is not intended to imply that hosts should support those protocols.

hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteRowStatus.name: hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteRowStatus
hpnicfmplsVpnVrfRouteRowStatus.description: Row status for this table. It is used according to row installation and removal conventions.
